feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Build Code
feed.subtitle: SAP Build Code Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP Build App Integration Issue with BTP Destination
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am facing an issue while integrating an SAP BTP destination with an SAP Build App. I have created a destination on SAP BTP and attempted to integrate it into my SAP Build App to fetch data entities. However, I encountered a "Connection Failed" error during the integration process.

Interestingly, when I review the data using SAP Build Code, I can see the entity details without any issues.

I suspect that the root cause of this issue is related to Additional Properties in the SAP BTP destination configuration, but I am not sure which properties need to be added or modified to resolve this issue.

Has anyone faced a similar issue? How can I resolve this connection failure in SAP Build App while the data is accessible in SAP Build Code?

entry.title: HTTP Error 403 When Trying to Open Application in SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
Dear Support Team,

I am reaching out regarding an issue I'm facing with SAP Build Apps. Every time I attempt to open my application, I am encountering an HTTP Error 403, which prevents the application from loading. This error seems to occur consistently, regardless of the time or the device I am using.

Could you kindly investigate this issue and provide guidance on how to resolve it? I would appreciate any troubleshooting steps, or if there is a configuration that I may need to adjust in order to gain access.

Looking forward to your assistance.

 

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Cannot connect to a service - Build code to SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Hello, I am developing an extension in SAP Build Code, and when trying to add a SSFF service, it does not appear as available.

The BTP Trial account has already been registered in the SSFF product, and the destination has been created.

 

As you mension in the help is not available for Full-Stack Application Using Productivity Tools dev space.

 

I wonder to know if there is another way to add a SSFF Service in Sap build code in a Full-Stack Application project using Productivity Tools dev space.

Has anyone else experienced the same issue? Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Issue with External Data Resource Not Returning Data in CDS View after Adding to Project
entry.content:
Hi, I am facing an issue with fetching external data from the SAP systemâs catalog of services.

Hereâs the scenario:

  1. I added the service by creating a new service of type ABAP catalog and connected it using on-prem connection through Cloud Connector. Once created, a destination was generated 

  2.  

  3. Then, I went to the Storyboard and added an external resource from the SAP system. I selected my service ZC_PURCHASEORDER_FS_SRV. In this step, I can see the live data,

  4. After that, I pressed "Add to Project".

  5. I created a service and imported a projection using the CDS file created in the external service.

  6. When I run the project using CDS W, I get no data returned.

  7.  

So, Iâm wondering if I missed a step or if thereâs something else that could be causing the issue as it worked with me in sap build apps. Has anyone encountered a similar issue, or could you point out what I might be doing wrong?

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Offline Capabilities and Best Approach for Mobile App Development (BTP SDK vs MDK)?
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We are developing a mobile application to simplify work order management for field maintenance teams. Due to network limitations in the areas where tasks are performed, the application needs to work offline. This means that time and material reporting must be sent to S/4HANA regardless of connectivity. As a result, whenever a technician updates information in the application, the data must be stored locally and later synchronized using the standard APIs from S/4HANA Asset Management.

After doing some research, we understand that there are two possible approaches:

  1. Build the application using Android Studio with the SAP BTP SDK for Android and SAP Mobile Services Cockpit.

  2. Build the application using SAP Mobile Development Kit (MDK) and SAP Mobile Services Cockpit.

As far as we can tell, both options support offline capabilities. However, we would like to know which option would be more suitable for our specific use case. We are particularly unsure whether both approaches fully support offline consumption of OData APIs from S/4HANA.

Thank you in advance for your guidance.

Best regards.

entry.title: Cant Download Base64 Files in SAP Build Apps on Mobile? It only take 1 min to do, Vote to Fix It!!
entry.content:
Iâve raised a feature request on the SAP Influence portal to enable Base64 file downloads in native mobile apps (Android/iOS) using SAP Build Apps. As of now, this functionality is only supported on web apps, which limits real-world mobile use cases like:

â Downloading PDFs, receipts, reports, CSVs on the go
â Offline access for field workers
â Handling file attachments directly from CAP/HANA Cloud responses
â Avoiding complex native plugin workarounds in a no-code/low-code platform

This improvement would allow smoother file handling from SAP Build Apps â CAP â mobile, making the ecosystem much more developer- and business-friendly.

ð Please take a moment to upvote the request here:
ð https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/346243

Letâs show SAP how much the community needs this!

ð¬ Feel free to drop your thoughts, use cases, or support in the comments below!

#SAPBuildApps #SAPBTP #SAPCAP #HANACloud #LowCode #MobileApps #SAPInfluence #FioriMobile #Base64Download #SAPCommunity SAP Build Apps

entry.title: Cannot connect to a service - Build code to SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Hello, I am developing an extension in SAP Build Code, and when trying to add a SSFF service, it does not appear as available.

 

 

The BTP Trial account has already been registered in the SSFF product, and the destination has been created.

 

 

As mentioned in the help documentation, it seems that this tool is not available when using the Full-Stack Application with the Productivity Tools dev space.

 

 

I would like to know if there is another way to add a SuccessFactors service in SAP Build Code within a Full-Stack Application project using the Productivity Tools dev space.

Has anyone else experienced the same issue?
Thanks in advance!

Is this code generation possible using Joule ?
I am using trial version of SAP BTP

Regards,
Priyanka

entry.title: Unable to format SAP build output coming from LLM
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am working on an copilot created using SAP Build apps which talks with SAP AI core instance to answer queries asked .

The app works perfectly fine but the outcome lacks formats and colors which we usually see when we ask similiar questions to other copilots or chatbots.

Please find attached my apps output and other copilots output .Can you help me how I can retain the format of the outcome of LLM and display it on my application?

SAP Build 

SAP AI Core

entry.title: Execute "BAPI_BUPA_PFCT_GETFUNCTDETAIL" in RPA
entry.content:
Hi

I am creating automation in iRPA

I am using BAPI SDK

I want to execute BAPI: "BAPI_BUPA_PFCT_GETFUNCTDETAIL"

I get the following error: "Error: BAPI exception : MESSAGE_TYPE_X\n    at a._handleResponse"

I am probably setting "Imports parameters" in wrong way but I have no documentation showing me what exactly should I do.

Do you know what might cause this problem or do you have documentation for this specific BAPI Name?

 

Thank you in advance

Mateusz

entry.title: Help in SAP Build Code
entry.content:
We are currently developing a project using SAP Build Code Fullstack. As part of this initiative, we needed to integrate the schema, services, and applications from a previously developed project in SAP Business Application Studio (BAS).

The migration was successfully completed in terms of file structure and syntax. The views in test mode render correctly and maintain the same structure as in the original BAS project. However, when working in the SAP Build Code environment, we consistently encounter the following issue:

Displayed message:

"Storyboard editor for 'MonitorFacturasBuild' will be displayed without attributes due to size limitations"

Once this message appears, the entire development environment freezes, and we are unable to interact with any files or components. Reloading or exiting the page does not resolve the issue, and the problem persists with every session.

entry.title: Unable to Access External Services from SAP Build Code-Based Fiori App
entry.content:
I have developed a Fiori application using SAP Build Code which primarily handles the frontend. The application is deployed in my SAP BTP subaccount and is functioning correctly from the UI perspective.

However, when attempting to integrate external servicesâspecifically backend services that are already deployed in the same BTP subaccountâthose services are not visible or accessible in the application. I have confirmed that:

 

  • The backend services are successfully deployed and running.

  • The destinations are configured correctly in BTP Cockpit.

entry.title: How to enable a button which is initially disabled on pressing another button in SAP MDK app?
entry.content: I am working on a MDK project using SAP build code. I have created two buttons Play and Stop using button table in Sectioned Table page. I have initially disabled the Stop button. I want to enable it when the Play button is pressed. What rule do I have to write to achieve this?

entry.title: Saving the Edited Fields of Data Table to backend
entry.content:
Hi MDK Experts,

I have been creating a sap mdk application using sap build code. So, I have encountered an issue where I have to save the edited values of a Data Table and push it to backend. I have two columns in Data Table which are editable. So, I want that if someone edits the value of the editable columns and clicks on save then it should push to the backend. Can you please help me with this?
